oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1941-12-20 - Part 2
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 2 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from December 20, 1941. Featuring Louie Buck (announcer), George D. Hay (host), and performers Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys, Ford Rush, Pap & Odie (likely Lonnie Wilson and Curly Rhodes respectively), the Gully Jumpers, Pee Wee King and his Golden West Cowboys with vocalist San Antonio Rose, Mac McGar and his Tennessee Mountaineers, Bashful Brother Oswald, and Rachel Veach. Held at War Memorial Auditorium, Nashville, TN.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Pee Wee King; Golden West Cowboys; San Antonio Rose; Roy Acuff; Smoky Mountain Boys; Mac McGar; Tennessee Mountaineers; Bashful Brother Oswald; Rachel Veach; Gully Jumpers
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: George D. Hay introduces Pee Wee King and his Golden West Cowboys with San Antonio Rose -- Walking The Floor Over You (Pee Wee King and his Golden West Cowboys, San Antonio Rose) -- Prince Albert commercial (Louie Buck) -- George D. Hay introduces Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys -- I Wonder Why You Said Goodbye (Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys) -- George D. Hay introduces Mac McGar and his Tennessee Mountaineers -- Turkey In The Straw (Mac McGar and his Tennessee Mountaineers) -- George D. Hay introduces Rachel Veach and Bashful Brother Oswald -- Jesse James (Rachel Veach, Bashful Brother Oswald) -- George D. Hay introduces the Gully Jumpers -- The Old Hen Cackled (Gully Jumpers) -- Prince Albert commercial (Louie Buck, George D. Hay) -- George D. Hay introduces Roy Acuff -- Ida Red (Roy Acuff) -- Closing statement (George D. Hay) -- Closing statement (Louie Buck)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; Grand ole opry (Radio program); Buck, Louis, 1910-1971; Hay, George D. (George Dewey), 1895-1968; Acuff, Roy; Smoky Mountain Boys; Rush, Ford, 1895-; Bashful Brother Oswald; Veach, Rachel; Pap & Odie; Wilson, Lonnie; Rhodes, Curly; McGar, Mac; Tennessee Mountaineers (Musical group : Mac McGar); King, Pee Wee, 1914-2000; Golden West Cowboys (Musical group); Gully Jumpers (Paul Warmack)
